title: News View :: The World On Arirang
text: Prime Minister Lee Nak-yon says he may be delivering a friendly letter from President Moon Jae-in to Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe during his 3-day trip to Tokyo next week.In an interview with Japan's Kyodo News, Lee said he is keen to play the role of messenger, adding he will listen to Abe's words sincerely and "do his best to explain the thoughts of President Moon and himself."The Blue House has not yet commented on President Moon sending a letter to the Abe.Lee is leaving for Tokyo next week to attend the Japanese Emperor's enthronement ceremony on October 22nd, and according to reports, the meeting between Lee and Abe may take place on the 23rd or the 24th.
description: 한국을 대표하는 글로벌 방송! The World On Arirang!
